medical_history.chief_complaint: Failure of elective toe-to-hand transfer surgery.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient sustained a crush/amputation of his dominant right thumb two years prior during an accident. Despite several surgical attempts, including replantation and subsequent flap coverage, the patient was referred for a modified right great toe-to-thumb transfer which initially showed good arterial flow but failed to perfuse postoperatively. Intraoperative flow testing revealed arterial thrombus leading to persistent issues with perfusion.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Homocystinuria (hyperhomocysteinemia), with an elevated serum homocysteine level of 63.6 Âµmol/L, indicative of moderate homocystinuria.
medical_history.family_history: Both the child and his father were found to have heterozygous mutations in the cystathionine-B-synthase gene.
